questions.question_text:
The admin at Universal Containers has created a Configuration Attribute in a bundle that allows the end user to choose a picklist field value. A Price Rule has been created in the calculator that will set a discount based on the chosen picklist field value. This discount should be applied on the bundle Product and its Options.
What should the admin do to confirm the Price Rule is working correctly when setting up the Configuration Attribute?

choices.C: Ensure that Apply to Product Options has been set to TRUE.
choices.B: Ensure that the Configuration Attribute's Feature field is set to Null.
choices.D: Ensure that Apply Immediately has been set to TRUE.
choices.A: Ensure that the Default Object field is set to Quote Line.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
--Apply to Product Options--
Apply the configuration attribute’s value to all matching fields in your bundle’s product options. When this field is not selected, Salesforce CPQ applies the value to only matching fields in the bundle parent.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_config_attribute_guidelines.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
The admin at Universal Containers (UC) has created one bundle that contains all of its Products as Options. The bundle has Subscription Pricing and Asset Conversion set to null on its Product record. Implementing the Product catalog via a bundle allows UC to enforce logic about which Products can be sold together. A bundle sold by UC contains a combination of Assets and Subscriptions.
After making selections within the bundle, a sales user saves the Quote and creates a Contract from the Opportunity associated with the primary Quote. Later, the sales user needs to amend this Contract based on new requirements from the customer. When UC amends the Contract using the Amend button, the sales user notices that the bundle is excluded in the Amendment Quote.
Why is the bundle excluded in the Amendment Quote?

choices.B: The parent Product is excluded from the amendment because it lacks an Asset or a Subscription.
choices.C: The sales user must use the Amend Assets field on the Account to amend a Contract which contains Assets.
choices.A: The sales user neglected to select the Preserve Bundle Structure field on the Contract.
choices.D: By default, bundled Assets and Subscriptions are excluded in Amendment Quotes.

comments.content: Actually the answer is B based on the question here and the explanation from the above link. "The parent Product is excluded from the amendment because it lacks an Asset or a Subscription" is the rightmost answer to the question why the product is excluded from the amendment.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct here.
Products with Asset Conversion = null and where Subscription Pricing & Subscription Term = null will not generate an asset or subscription.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000392984&type=1
B is tricky but D is right.

B is the only possible answer here
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000392984&type=1

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer as the question asks the reason for missing from the Amendment Quote. Preserve bundle structure is nothing but maintaining the bundle options together which is not the purpose of the question.

Selected Answer: A
I thought it might be B, but looks like it's A
Contract: Preserve Bundle Structure = FALSE will remove bundle structure, losing assets that are not covered by percent of total products.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000392984&type=1
D - but using MDQ - pricing on a yearly basis tells me to use Price dimensions.

• Subscription Type: One-Time
• Subscription Pricing: Fixed Price
choices.C:
• Subscription Term: 1
• Subscription Type: Evergreen
• Subscription Pricing: Percent of Total
choices.A:
• Subscription Term: l
• Subscription Type: One-Time
• Subscription Pricing: Percent of Total
choices.B:
• Subscription Term: 12
• Subscription Type: Evergreen
• Subscription Pricing: Fixed Price

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers sells a non-renewable subscription Product that is priced on a yearly basis.
Which Subscription field values should the admin set to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
A. Create a condition to evaluate a Summary Variable over previous subscriptions.

Price Rule - Calculator / On Calculate
Price Condition
Summary Variable >= 1
(Summary Variable: Function = Sum, Field = Quantity, add the filters to sum ProductA)
Quote Line product Code equals ProductA

Price Action
Target: Quote Line
Target Field: ListPrice

Formula = OriginalPrice*.90

similar exercise: https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/price-rules-in-salesforce-cpq/summarize-data-with-summary-variables

Selected Answer: D
--Existing--
Indicates that the customer already owns this product. This checkbox is typically used for products with options during add-on quoting. The product is on the quote solely to drive the Configurator.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_quote_line_fields.htm&type=5

choices.D: Create a condition that checks that the Quote Line's Existing checkbox is set to True.
choices.A: Create a condition to evaluate a Summary Variable over previous subscriptions.
choices.C: Create an Option Constraint with Check Prior Purchases set to True.
choices.B: Create a lookup query to check subscriptions for previously purchased products.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to provide a 10% discount to Product A, but only when customers who have previously purchased at least one unit of Product A decide to purchase more. The CPQ admin has set up a price rule, but it is currently running on all lines that contain Product A. Product A is a subscription product.
How should the CPQ admin prevent this rule from firing when a customer first purchases Product A?
